required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcome of TKA Using Customized Cutting Block Compared With Conventional Intramedullary Cutting Guide
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Customized Cutting Block (Visionaireâ„¢) and Conventional Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Prospective Randomized Control Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Customized cutting block and conventional cutting guide are both effective in improving accuracy and function of OA knee patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Customized cutting block and conventional cutting guide are both effective in improving accuracy and function of osteoarthritic knee patients.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Mechanical Axis Alignment (Absolute Value Measured in Degrees) Using 3 Feet Long Leg Films
primary_outcome.description: Femoral Valgus Angle, Tibial varus angle, Tibial slope, Femoral Flexsion/Extension angle, Implant Rotation

arm_group.description: Standard cutting guides use traditional instrumentation to determine knee implant positions. During surgery, a rod is placed in the leg bone and the cutting guide is attached to that rod.

Patient specific cutting guides are custom-made for each patient based on Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI). Before surgery, MRI of the knee is done and used to create a cutting guide that is formed to the exact shape of the knee. The patient specific cutting guides have platforms that can be attached to the bone, so the rod does not need to be placed in the leg bone.

intervention.description: Patient specific cutting guides are custom-made for each patient based on Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI). Before surgery, MRI of the knee is done and used to create a cutting guide that is formed to the exact shape of the knee. The patient specific cutting guides have platforms that can be attached to the bone, so the rod does not need to be placed in the leg bone.
Standard cutting guides use traditional instrumentation to determine knee implant positions. During surgery, a rod is placed in the leg bone and the cutting guide is attached to that rod.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 60-90
- Diagnosis of osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis of the knee and qualify for surgery, as indicated by one of the following:
- Painful and disabled knee joint resulting from osteoarthritis where one or more compartments are involved;
- Correction of varus or valgus.
- Willing to participate and return for follow-up study visits.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Vascular insufficiency
- Previous deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism
- Previous osteotomy
- Previous patella fracture or surgery
- Previous healed tibia or femur fractures
- Previous joint replacement surgery
